intro: Silaum tenellum, commonly known as the lesser silaum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Silaum tenellum is relatively uncommon and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological niche and limited distribution.
